alert.note: Alert for Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 12:48AM CDT until June 06 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Phillips and Rooks. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1247 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. No additional rainfall is expected. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dibble Creek, Ash Creek, Borin Creek, Bow Creek, North Fork Solomon River, East Branch Jim Creek, Jim Creek, Deer Creek, Kirwin Reservoir Area, South Fork Solomon River, Cocklebur Creek, Wolf Creek, Douglas Creek, Elm Creek and Medicine Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stockton, Kirwin, Woodston and Speed.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
